text.84_Daf, 80_Line: Yes Nakain shall be executed since it is written "In secret places does Nakai slay."
text.84_Daf, 92_Line: Yes Buni shall be executed since it is written "behold I will slay thy son thy first born"...
text.84_Daf, 97_Line: Yes Todah shall be executed since it is written "Who offers the sacrifice of Todah honorred me"
text.84_Daf, 75_Line: Yes, Matthai shall be executed since it is written "Matthai, when shall he die and his name perish?"
text.84_Daf, 83_Line: Is it now written "and Nezer shall grow forth out of his roots"?
text.84_Daf, 26_Line: R. Chiya b. R. Ashi in the name of R. Chisda said:
text.138_Daf, 45_Line: R. Amram, the son of R. Simon b. Abba, said:
text.84_Daf, 76_Line: When Nakai was brought in he said
text.84_Daf, 95_Line: Is it not written "a psalm for thanksgiving"?
text.84_Daf, 70_Line: Yeshu had five disciples Matthai Nakai Nezer Buni and Todah
text.138_Daf, 47_Line: When R. Dimi came from Palestine, he said :
text.138_Daf, 36_Line: "What does the passage (Ib. 23, 31) Do not look for wine when it looketh red, mean? You shall not look for wine which makes the faces of the wicked in this world red, and makes them pale (puts them to shame) in the world to come."
text.138_Daf, 44_Line: "Wine and good odor made me wise."
text.138_Daf, 40_Line: It is written (Pr. 104, 15) Y'shamach (waste), and we read Y'samach (rejoice) ; i.e., If he merits (takes care) it will cause him to rejoice; if not, it will cause him ruin,
text.138_Daf, 46_Line: "What does the passage (Ib., ib. 26, 30) Who hath woe? Who hath sorrow? Who hath quarrels? Who hath complaints? Who hath wounds without cause? Who hath redness of eyes? They that tarry late over the wine; they that become sick for mixed drink, mean?
text.84_Daf, 27_Line: "The one who was going to be killed, they used to give a grain of frankincense in a cup of wine to drink in order to benumb his senses, as it is said (Prov. 31:6) Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those who have an embittered soul."
text.84_Daf, 93_Line: When Todah was brought before them he said
text.84_Daf, 81_Line: When Nezer was brought in he said
text.84_Daf, 73_Line: Is it not written, "Matthai shall I come and appear before God?"
text.84_Daf, 71_Line: When Matthai was brought (before the court) he said (to the judges)
text.84_Daf, 90_Line: Is it not written "Buni my first born"?
text.84_Daf, 78_Line: Is it not written "Nakai and the righteous slay thou not"?
text.138_Daf, 48_Line: "It was said in the West that he who tries to explain the passage above from the beginning to the end is correct, and he who tries to explain it from the end to the beginning is also correct.
text.84_Daf, 86_Line: Nezer shall be executed since it is written "but thou art cast forth away from thy grave like Nezer"
text.138_Daf, 34_Line: "Wine was created for nothing else than to comfort mourners and to compensate through it the wicked for any good thing they do in this world, as it is said (Pr. 31, 6) Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish and wine to those who have an embittered soul."
text.138_Daf, 39_Line: R. Cahana raised the following contradiction:
text.138_Daf, 43_Line: and this is meant by Raba who said:
text.84_Daf, 87_Line: When Buni was brought in he said
text.138_Daf, 38_Line: "You shall not look for wine because its end is bloodshed."
